author: sky.cactus
content: I don't think there was ever a particularly *good* reason to do issuance reduction at the same time as ice age pushes though.

author: sky.cactus
content: Even when you do the issuance reduction after the ice age bomb lands, it still is a pretty weak argument.  Along the lines of, "we accidentally decreased inflation for a few months, that means that we should leave inflation at that rate permanently".

author: _shemnon
content: Really there wasn't enough time to have a real discussion on what issuance should be when Muir Glacier was proposed.  If we had put it in with Istanbul and discussed it for 6 months I bet it would have happened.

author: _shemnon
content: My perspective is 1559 fee burn could serve as the next ice age reward reduction.  But bringing the reward back to 5 is a non-starter.

author: timbeiko
content:
I think the original premise was something along the lines of "the difficulty bomb was supposed to get us to Eth2, which has lower issuance. because we're going to be late shipping Eth2, we should somewhat compensate people who had an expectation of lowered issuance, so let's reduce the supply". 

Worth noting that in the <#798586271445680129> channel, a lot of folks are claiming that the 3->2 issuance was somehow linked to a soft promise of ProgPow going live, and they were obviously frustrated when that didn't happen.
